activity.includedActivitiesStart: The activity starts with opening, mixing, layering, humidification,carding, Needle punching
activity.includedActivitiesEnd: This process ends with cutting and packaging of Needle punched Nonwovewoven fabric

generalComment.text: Inventory refers to production of1 kg Nonwoven Needlepunched textile . This dataset is a copy of Indian dataset.

Needlepunching is a nonwoven process by which the fibres are mechanically entangled to produce a nonwoven fabric by repeated penetration of barbed needles through a preformed dry fibrous web. The machine which accomplishes this process is known as needle loom.
The Needle punch webs offer a wide range of product characteristics such as:
Unique physical properties i.e., elongation in the X, Y & Z direction for mould-able applications,
Ability to attach layers of different type fibre webs to produce composites,
High opacity per unit area,
High strength makes them overwhelming choice for geotextile fabric
The major Application and End-usages of needle punch fabrics are:
Geotextiles :
Needle punch geotextiles are used in functions like
Separation,
Filtration,
Reinforcement,
Drainage & erosion control and
Find applications in roads, railways, air runways, coastal shore protection, etc.
Needle punch carpets: They are used in passenger cars as flooring material.
Other Miscellaneous Applications :
Headliners,
Filtration,
Insulation Felts, etc.

comment.text: This dataset is a copy of Indian dataset

intermediateExchange.name: textile, nonwoven polyester

property.name: carbon content, fossil
property.comment: Assumed equal to carbon content, fossil in polyester.

property.name: carbon content, non-fossil
property.comment: biogene carbon content on a dry matter basis

property.name: heating value, net
property.comment: LHV is calculated based on the Carbon content of the product. More details can be found on the respective documentation.

property.name: price
property.comment: Estimated value. Various souces report a value around, what correspond to, 2.6 EUR per kg of non woven polyester fabric (madeinchina.com. Retrieved from: https://www.made-in-china.com/productdirectory.do?word=polyester+non+woven+fabric&subaction=hunt&style=b&mode=and&code=0&comProvince=nolimit&order=0&isOpenCorrection=1, accessed 1Feb2018; Alibaba.com, 2018. Retrieved from: https://www.alibaba.com/showroom/100-polyester-non-woven-fabric.html, accessed 1Feb2018).

property.name: water content
property.comment: water mass/dry mass

property.name: water in wet mass
property.comment: wet mass - dry mass

intermediateExchange.productionVolumeComment:
According to NONWOVENS INDUSTRY magazine, the production volume of synthetic fibers in 2016 was 71 million tons. From those, 83.7% is calculated to be polyester fibers as reported in "Textile exchange".
References: NONWOVENS INDUSTRY magazine, accessed at: https://www.nonwovens-industry.com/about-us/ on 09/04/2018 Textile exchange, TE Preferred Fiber Market Report accessed, 2016 at: http://textileexchange.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/TE-Preferred-Fiber-Market-Report-Oct2016-1.pdf on 09/04/2018

intermediateExchange.name: fibre and fabric waste, polyester
intermediateExchange.comment: includes both fibre and fabric cuttings. Used for manufacture of low grade floor covering/carpet

property.name: carbon content, fossil
property.comment:
0.585840437101837 for polyester resin production, unsaturated.
(C8H6O2, C8H16O4, C5H12O2,C4H2O3)n was used as a representative formula for unsaturated polyester resin. This formula corresponds to the M390B Unsaturated Polyester Resin (National Industrial Chemicals Notification and Assessment Scheme, full public report, 1994).

property.name: heating value, net
property.comment: Assumed equal to "textile, polyester"

property.name: price
property.comment: Assumed without economic value

property.name: water in wet mass
property.comment: wet mass - dry mass

intermediateExchange.productionVolumeComment: Calculated from production volume of reference product using the relative outputs.

classification.classificationValue: 550510: Fibres; waste (including noils, yarn waste and garnetted stock), of synthetic fibres

property.name: heating value, net
property.comment: LHV is calculated based on the Carbon content of the product. More details can be found on the respective documentation.

property.name: price
property.comment: Calculated value based on data from United Nations Commodity Trade Statistics Database (comtrade.un.org). UN comtrade category: 550951. Year 2016. Using exchange rate of 1EURO = 1.209 USD. Average of price of import into 4 main markets (US, JP, IN and CN).

classification.classificationValue: 35510: Synthetic filament tow and staple fibres, not carded or combed
550320: Fibres; synthetic staple fibres, of polyesters, not carded, combed or otherwise processed for spinning

intermediateExchange.name: wastewater, average
intermediateExchange.comment: 0.05 kgs converted to cubic meters

property.name: carbon content, non-fossil
property.comment: 0.0673 kg TOC/m3 (Tab A.17, ecoinvent v2.2 report 13_I). TOC was considered as Total Carbon.

property.name: dry mass
property.comment: The addition of compounds in water, listed in Tab A.17-20 from ecoinvent v2.2 report 13_I, has been used as an estimate of dry mass is wastewater. In this case, elementary composition has been expressed as molecular composition, whenever possible. This approach has been used when the addition of compunds in wastewater was bigger than the minimal mineral content estimated using the chemical properties of tap water in ecoinvent v2.2 report 8, Tab 93.1.

property.name: price
property.comment: Waste products are assigned a price of zero as they are assumed to require further treatment.

property.name: water content
property.comment: water mass/dry mass

property.name: water in wet mass
property.comment: wet mass-dry mass

property.name: wet mass
property.comment: Density of water was assumed that of tap water 1kg/L, that is 1000kg/m3.

intermediateExchange.productionVolumeComment: Calculated from production volume of reference product using the relative outputs.

property.name: carbon content, fossil
property.comment: Tab 4.8, calculated from bicarbonate content in river (The Natural Water Cycle, by UNESCO)

property.name: dry mass
property.comment: TDS in an average river used as approximation. That is, 110.1 mg/L (The Natural Water Cycle, by UNESCO)

property.name: water content
property.comment: water mass/dry mass

representativeness.samplingProcedure: Extrapolated from IN data, uncertainty adjusted accordingly

review.otherDetails:
Validation warnings:
- Mass and/or economic deficit in activity dataset exceeds either 0.1% of input or output sum:
Property 'carbon content, non-fossil': - Input='0', Output='3,36499999999999E-06' - Input < output by 3,36499999999999E-06 kg (100% of output)
Property 'wet mass': - Input='2,535', Output='1,5' - Input > output by 1,035 kg (69% of output)
Property 'carbon content, fossil': - Input='0,646876722986073', Output='0' - Input > output by 0,646876722986073 kg
Property 'dry mass': - Input='1,03516515', Output='1,73418387300645E-05' - Input > output by 1,03514780816127 kg (5969077,58% of output)
Property 'price': - Input='2,26458', Output='0' - Input > output by 2,26458 EUR2005
- Property 'wet mass=1' of master data exchange was removed from exchange 'fibre and fabric waste, polyester'. Property 'water content=0' of master data exchange was removed from exchange 'fibre and fabric waste, polyester'. Property 'carbon content, fossil=0,585840437101837' of master data exchange was removed from exchange 'fibre and fabric waste, polyester'. Property 'carbon content, non-fossil=0' of master data exchange was removed from exchange 'fibre and fabric waste, polyester'. Property 'dry mass=1' of master data exchange was removed from exchange 'fibre and fabric waste, polyester'.
- The dataset contains user added exchange master data entries. The following user added exchanges do not contain product information data. Please consider adding the appropriate data before submitting the dataset for review. - textile, non woven polyester
- Uncertainty shall always be provided for all primary data inputs (exchange amounts, properties and parameters), except for the amount and properties of reference products. -- Property(ies): wet mass=1000, carbon content, fossil=0, carbon content, non-fossil=0,194039401033427, dry mass=0,346836774601289, water content=2882,20060970917, water in wet mass=999,653163225399, water in wet mass=999,8899, carbon content, non-fossil=0, wet mass=1000, carbon content, fossil=0,0104328554239022, dry mass=0,1101, water content=9081,65213442325, water in wet mass=1000, carbon content, non-fossil=0, carbon content, fossil=0, dry mass=0, wet mass=1000
- Pedigree information shall always be provided for all uncertainties of primary data inputs (exchange amounts, properties and parameters), except for the amount and properties of reference products. -- Property(ies): wet mass=1000, carbon content, fossil=0, carbon content, non-fossil=0,194039401033427, dry mass=0,346836774601289, water content=2882,20060970917, water in wet mass=999,653163225399, water in wet mass=999,8899, carbon content, non-fossil=0, wet mass=1000, carbon content, fossil=0,0104328554239022, dry mass=0,1101, water content=9081,65213442325, water in wet mass=1000, carbon content, non-fossil=0, carbon content, fossil=0, dry mass=0, wet mass=1000
- For by-products/wastes, a market activity (currently missing) that supplies the output 'fibre and fabric waste, polyester' must exist for a geographical area and time period including the location and time period of the activity. If the the market dataset is not available the dataset will be put on hold at the end of its review and will remain on hold until such a market dataset has been accepted into the ecoinvent database. - The input exchange 'polyester fibre' does not have an activity link and therefore requires a market for that input to be available. If the market is not available the dataset will be put on hold at the end of its review and will remain on hold until such a market has been accepted into the ecoinvent database.
